title: GetDatabaseConnection() — GetDatabaseConnection
text: function returns odbc database connection AK_ShallowLakes database. function mostly used internally functions NPSShallowLakes package, can use part database queries.

title: GetDatabaseConnection() — GetDatabaseConnection
text: odbc database connection object.

title: GetDatabaseConnection() — GetDatabaseConnection
code: # Get a connection to the AK_ShallowLakes database Connection = GetDatabaseConnection() #> Error: ! ODBC failed with error 00000 from [unixODBC][Driver Manager]. #> ✖ Can't open lib 'Sql Server' : file not found #> ℹ From nanodbc/nanodbc.cpp:1150. # Execute the query into a data frame data = odbc::dbGetQuery(Connection,'SELECT Top 3 PONDNAME FROM tblPonds') #> Error: unable to find an inherited method for function ‘dbGetQuery’ for signature ‘conn = "logical", statement = "character"’ head(data) #>                                                                              #> 1 function (..., list = character(), package = NULL, lib.loc = NULL,         #> 2     verbose = getOption("verbose"), envir = .GlobalEnv, overwrite = TRUE)  #> 3 {                                                                          #> 4     fileExt <- function(x) {                                               #> 5         db <- grepl("\\\\.[^.]+\\\\.(gz|bz2|xz)$", x)                      #> 6         ans <- sub(".*\\\\.", "", x)

title: GetLakeCoordinatesTable — GetLakeCoordinatesTable
text: GetLakeCoordinatesTable function returns data frame spatial coordinates geographic coordinate system (Lat/Lon) shallow lakes monitoring lake .

title: GetLakeCoordinatesTable — GetLakeCoordinatesTable
text: Lake Lake spatial coordinates returned.

title: GetLakeCoordinatesTable — GetLakeCoordinatesTable
text: data frame coordinates Lake.

title: GetLakeCoordinatesTable — GetLakeCoordinatesTable
code: # Get a data frame of spatial coordinates for Lake YUCH-004 LakeCoordinates = GetLakeCoordinatesTable('YUCH-004') #> Error: ! ODBC failed with error 00000 from [unixODBC][Driver Manager]. #> ✖ Can't open lib 'Sql Server' : file not found #> ℹ From nanodbc/nanodbc.cpp:1150. #> Error: unable to find an inherited method for function ‘dbGetQuery’ for signature ‘conn = "logical", statement = "character"’ head(LakeCoordinates) #> [1] NA

title: GetLakeMap — GetLakeMap
text: Function retrieve spatial coordinates Lake AK_ShallowLakes:tblMonuments table display Leaflet map.

title: GetLakeMap — GetLakeMap
text: Lake Lake spatial coordinates returned ZoomLevel Initial zoom level lake map. Around 12-15 usually appropriate. user may change zoom level map generated.

title: GetLakeMap — GetLakeMap
text: Leaflet map Lake.

title: GetLakeMap — GetLakeMap

title: GetWaterProfilePlotForLake — GetWaterProfilePlotForLake
text: GetWaterProfilePlotForLake function returns depth profile plot temperature sampling date Lake.

title: GetWaterProfilePlotForLake — GetWaterProfilePlotForLake
text: Lake Name lake profile. Parameter Parameter plot. Options 'Temperature','pH','','DO_PCT'. Anything else cause database error.

title: GetWaterProfilePlotForLake — GetWaterProfilePlotForLake
text: depth profile plot Parameter sampling date Lake.

title: GetWaterProfilesDataSummary — GetWaterProfilesDataSummary
text: GetWaterProfilesDataSummary function returns summary water profile parameters sample replicates (usually ,B,C,etc.) grouped Lake sampling date. Statistics include mean, min, max, SD n) lake sampling date. statistics returned function calculated AK_ShallowLakes database view (query) [Summary_WaterProfileStatisticsByLake]. Results returned data frame.

title: GetWaterProfilesDataSummary — GetWaterProfilesDataSummary
text: data frame water profile statistics temperature, pH, dissolved oxygen.

title: GetWaterProfilesDataSummary — GetWaterProfilesDataSummary
code: # Example of use: data = GetWaterProfilesDataSummary head(data) #>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          #> 1 function ()                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            #> 2 {                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      #> 3     Connection <- tryCatch({                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           #> 4         Connection = GetDatabaseConnection()                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           #> 5         Sql = " SELECT [PONDNAME]\\n,[SAMPLEDATE]\\n,Month(SampleDate) as [Month]\\n,Case When Month(SampleDate) < 7 Then 'Spring' Else 'Fall' End as Season\\n,[SAMPLEDEPTH]\\n,[Temperature_Mean]\\n,[Temperature_Min]\\n,[Temperature_Max]\\n,[Temperature_SD]\\n,[Temperature_n]\\n,[pH_Mean]\\n,[pH_Min]\\n,[pH_Max]\\n,[pH_SD]\\n,[pH_n]\\n,[SpCond_Mean]\\n,[SpCond_Min]\\n,[SpCond_Max]\\n,[SpCond_SD]\\n,[SpCond_n]\\n,[DO_Mean]\\n,[DO_Min]\\n,[DO_Max]\\n,[DO_SD]\\n,[DO_n]\\n,[DO_Pct_Mean]\\n,[DO_Pct_Min]\\n,[DO_Pct_Max]\\n,[DO_Pct_SD]\\n,[DO_Pct_n]\\nFROM [AK_ShallowLakes].[dbo].[Summary_WaterProfileStatisticsByLake]\\nORDER BY PONDNAME,SAMPLEDATE,SAMPLEDEPTH" #> 6         DF = odbc::dbGetQuery(Connection, Sql)
